name: Stained-Glass Moth
movement: walk 20 ft., climb 20 ft., fly 30 ft.
description: The Stained-Glass Moth resembles a beautiful, ornate stained-glass window, especially when motionless. Its wings sparkle with various colors, and it features a delicate, almost fragile appearance.
memorable: Its ability to blend in as a stained-glass window provides unique tactical advantages and surprises in encounters.
goals: To ambush unsuspecting foes, mark targets for strategic advantages, and defend its territory.
relations: Typically found alongside other constructs or in magical environments, often serving as guardians.
environment: Commonly encountered in magical landscapes, temples, or areas with a lot of stained glass.
strengths: High constitution grants it resilience, while magic resistance provides advantages against spell attacks.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to bludgeoning and thunder damage, which can significantly impair its combat effectiveness.
attacks: Capable of making multiple attacks, including slashing and radiant damage options, and providing tactical advantages to allies.
most_powerful_ability: Blessed Wings allows it to mark targets, giving advantages to its allies or increasing defenses for friendly targets.
senses: It has darkvision and a passive perception of 14, allowing it to see in darkness and be reasonably aware of its surroundings.
skills: Proficient in perception, granting it increased awareness.
additional_information: Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep due to its construct nature.
Immutable form makes it immune to form-altering spells and effects.
Can avoid opportunity attacks while flying, increasing mobility.
test_queries: agile moth that blends into windows
